meanings.definition: To surpass in performance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: The young athlete outperformed all her competitors in the race.
meanings.sent2: The new model of the car outperformed the older version in fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outperformed the other animals in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The student outperformed expectations in the math competition, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The singer outperformed all others with her powerful voice during the concert.

meanings.definition: To do better than someone or something else in a particular activity or competition.
meanings.sent1: The team outperformed their opponents in every game of the season.
meanings.sent2: The new software outperformed the old one in speed and efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The chef outperformed himself by creating a new signature dish that amazed the customers.
meanings.sent4: The company outperformed its competitors by launching a successful marketing campaign.
meanings.sent5: The student outperformed his classmates in the science fair with his innovative project.
